answers.answer: Hi,There could be many causes of throbbing pain in leg. Some of them are- Arthritis,  Blood clots, such as a deep venous thrombosis, Nerve damage, or Neuropathy. Nerve damage may be caused by Diabetes and Vitamin deficiencies. Sciatica, poor blood circulation caused by atherosclerosis, cancer or a tumor and osteomyelitis may be some of the other causes leading to throbbing pain. Please go for MRI of the leg and consult a neurologist and orthopedic surgeon for examination, diagnosis and treatment. Hope this helps you. Take care and regards!

question: Why is it that my leg throbbs so much? i feel the pain run from the back of my knee down to the bottom of my foot. it hurts really bad,it come and go during the week. But yesterday it started in the evening and went on all night and still this morning its hurts.It comes in pulses,as if it were runing threw my vein or artery. its dosen't feel like Restless leg Syndrome at all...ive been there, its like your leg dosnt want to stay still and it just feel jittery as if you where on a plan and could not get up off your seat.So i know it cant be that...please help.This discussion is related to/posts/show/897511.
title: Tthrobbing pain in the leg.
